name: Hodag
description: A large beast with formidable physical prowess, known for its strong frame and sharp teeth, claws, and horns, making it a fearsome opponent in close combat.
memorable: Its ability to charge and knock down foes, combined with its improved critical attack chance, makes it a dangerous melee combatant.
goals: Typically seeks to dominate opponents through sheer physical strength and intimidate through its presence.
relations: Might be encountered in the company of other large beasts or predators in its territory.
environment: Often found in forests or wilderness areas where it can rely on its stealthy nature.
strengths: Exceptional Strength and the ability to charge and knock down foes enhances its combat effectiveness.
weaknesses: Lacks ranged attacks and spells, relying solely on physical attributes in combat.
attacks: Multiattack options include a bite, claws, tail, and horns, each dealing significant damage.
most_powerful_ability: Territorial Display, which can deal thunder damage and knock opponents prone.
senses: Has keen hearing and smell, giving it advantage on perception checks related to sound or scent.
skills: Proficient in Stealth, allowing it to move quietly, and has good perception skills.
additional_information: Can score critical hits on a roll of 19 or 20.
Utilizes its size and strength to overpower opponents.
Can inflict extra damage when charging.
Territorial nature may create fear in nearby creatures.
test_queries: monster that charges and knocks down
powerful melee creature in the wilderness
strong creature with keen hearing and smell
